acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was suggested that relevant toxicity is not indicated within the water solubility (1.25*10-11mg/L (PHYSPROP Database (2005)) of this substance in spite of 24 hours EC50>66mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (EHC152 (1994)), it was classified into Not classified.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (EHC 152 (1994)) and rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of >8,000mg/kg (EHC 152 (1994)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg and >20,000mg/kg (EHC 152 (1994)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category R (Polybrominated Biphenyls) by NTP (2005), Category 2B (Polybrominated biphenyls) by IARC (1987) and Category 2B (Polybrominated Biphenyls) by the Japan Society for Occupational Health (2005).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although it is water-insolubility and acute toxicity was not reported within the aqueous solubility concentrations and there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0.8%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since the bio-accumulation (BCF=5.4(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) was low, it was classified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Class 9 (UN#3152 Polyhalogenated Biphenyls (solid), or Polyhalogenated Terphenyls (solid)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in EHC 152 (1994).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is used as a flame retardant (EHC 152 (1994)). Classified into Class 9 (UN#3152 Polyhalogenated Biphenyls (solid), or Polyhalogenated Terphenyls (solid)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Class 9 (UN#3152 Polyhalogenated Biphenyls (solid), or Polyhalogenated Terphenyls (solid)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (EHC 152 (1994)): "Caused mild irritation."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (exposure duration unknown) (PATTY (4th, 2000)): "Mild rash and edematous response occurred at the abraded and intact skin sites in four of six treated animals" and the substance is "classified as an only mild skin irritant."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
